content.text:
# List of protein tandem repeat annotation software

Computational methods use different properties of protein sequences and structures to find, characterize and annotate protein tandem repeats.
Sequence-based annotation methods
{| class="wikitable sortable"
|-
!Name
!Last update
!Usage
!Result types
!Description
!Open source?
!Repeat type specific
!Reference
|-
|[http://cbdm-01.zdv.uni-mainz.de/~fournier/ard2/ ard2]
|2013
|web
|annotated sequence
|Neural network
|no
|alpha-solenoid
|
|-
|[http://DECIPHER.codes/ DECIPHER]
|2021
|downloadable
|
|Detection of tandem and/or interspersed repeats by orthology (DetectRepeats function in R package)
|yes
|no
|
|-
|[http://www.ibi.vu.nl/programs/trustwww/ TRUST]
|2004
|downloadable / web
|unit position, multiple sequence alignment
|Ab-initio determination of internal repeats in proteins. Exploits transitivity of alignments
|?
|no
|
|-
|[https://bioinfo.crbm.cnrs.fr/index.php?route=tools&tool=3 T-REKS]
|2009
|downloadable / web
|repeat unit
|Clustering of lengths between identical short strings by using a K-means algorithm
|yes
|no
|
|-
|[https://toolkit.tuebingen.mpg.de/#/tools/hhrepid HHRepID]
|2008
|downloadable / web
|
|Identification of repeats in protein sequences via HMM-HMM comparison to exploit evolutionary information in the form of  multiple sequence alignments of homologs
|no
|
|
|-
|[https://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/services/web/toolresult.ebi?jobId=radar-I20190207-165422-0973-23804756-p2m RADAR]
|2018
|downloadable / web
|unit position, multiple sequence alignment
|RADAR identifies short composition biased and gapped approximate repeats, as well as complex repeat architectures involving many different types of repeats in a query sequence
|yes
|no
|
|-
|[http://jimcooperlab.mcdb.ucsb.edu/xstream/ XSTREAM]
|2007
|web
|unit position, different periods, multiple sequence alignment
|data-mining tool designed to efficiently identify Tandem Repeat (TR) patterns in biological sequence data. The program uses a seed-extension strategy coupled with several post-processing algorithms to analyze FASTA-formatted protein or nucleotide sequences
|no
|no
|
|-
|[http://www.sci.brooklyn.cuny.edu/~sokol/trepeats TRED]
|2007
|downloadable
|
|definition for tandem repeats over the edit distance and an efficient, deterministic algorithm for finding these repeats
|no
|no
|
|-
|[https://acg-team.github.io/tral/ TRAL]
|2015
|downloadable
|
|Detects tandem repeats with both de novo software and sequence profile HMMs; statistical significance analysis of putative tandem repeats, and filtering of redundant predictions
|yes
|
|
|-
|[https://sonnhammer.sbc.su.se/Dotter.html DOTTER]
|1995
|downloadable
|
|Graphical dotplot program for detailed comparison of two sequences
|
|
|
|-
|0J.PY
|
|
|
|
|
|
|
|-
|[http://bioalgo.iit.cnr.it/index.php?pg=ptrs PTRStalker]
|2012
|downloadable
|unit position, multiple sequence alignment
|Ab-initio detection of fuzzy tandem repeats in protein amino acid sequences.
|
|no
|
|-
|[https://bioinfo.crbm.cnrs.fr/?route=tools&tool=5 TRDistiller]
|2015
|
|
|Rapid sorting of tandem repeat (TR)- and no-TR-containing sequences
|
|
|
|-
|[http://www.ibi.vu.nl/programs/reprowww/ REPRO]
|2000
|web
|
|Repeats detection based on a variation of the Smith-Waterman local alignment strategy followed by a graph-based iterative clustering procedure
|no
|no
|
|
|-
|[http://www.bork.embl.de/~andrade/papers/rep/search.html REP]
|2000
|web

|
|no
|yes

Structure-based annotation methods
{| class="wikitable sortable"
|-
!Name
!Last update
!Usage
!Result types
!Description
!Open source?
!Repeat type specific
!Reference
|-
|[https://bioinfo.crbm.cnrs.fr/?route=tools&tool=2 TAPO]
|2016
|web
|unit position
|Uses periodicities of atomic coordinates and other types of structural representation, including strings generated by conformational alphabets, residue contact maps, and arrangements of vectors of secondary structure elements
|no
|no
|
|-
|[https://symd.nci.nih.gov/ SYMD]
|2014
|galaxy
|repeat geometry
|Detects internally symmetric protein structures through an "alignment scan" procedure in which a protein structure is aligned to itself after circularly permuting the second copy by all possible number of residues
|no
|no
|
|-
|[http://protein.bio.unipd.it/raphael/ RAPHAEL]
|2012
|web
|repeat probability
|Reduce to three dimensional structure to a wave function. It then determines periodicity information.
|no
